ygData.subject: RE: Great post on item balancing (Long)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Too many resists cause problems when fighting monster L40+, that is what I was referring to.  I d rather chain something, or try to chain something, then
ygData.messageBody:
> Chains does matter, I always keep it handy for emergency runner control.
> Remember our BIG advantage in snaring runners 1) We can 'cast' while
> running. 2) We can start it when the target is out of sight and only have to
> be in sight when is finishes casting. 3)We NEVER are OOM. and 4) We can
> 'cast' while running.

Too many resists cause problems when fighting monster L40+, that is what
I was referring to. I'd rather chain something, or try to chain
something, then call for a snare before the monster runs. Either
way, chains are not as useful as they once were. Chains interferes
with shaman drowsy and enchanter slowdowns, for sure. I let the
casters slow and the ranger snare, since I have much more important
things to twist. (If someone does go on the run, yes running and
casting is an awesome thing that people overlook frequently)

> Still using charm at 39th, great for saving that party member that is at
> half a bubble, or pulling the Dar off the cleric.

Again, Lguk / SolB - that all ends. Not much to charm anymore.


> who cares about holding them? When I can interrupt the casting of froglok
> wizard 90% of the time with a well placed pixie strike I am a happy camper.

Your 3 sec cast + 1 sec to even hit the button once you see the caster
visual, is typically not enough time to sink an interrupt unless you
devote yourself to pixie'ing the mob forever, I'd rather twist magic
and something else.

> Heh I never play mana song alone unless I am being lazy, you can weave it
> with on other song without losing effect. You can even do it with 2 songs +
> mana and still get 80% of the effect of playing mana song alone. Do not
> listen to greedy casters that say play mana only unless you want to 8)

Since mana song is instant effect, and not pulse based, twisting
it just hurts the effectiveness. That said, I still do twist it
in, but only after berserk and psalm are up. Unless I have like
a party of five wizards, hehehe.

Harmonic.
